p: GBV-C infection increases with age but produces no known clinical illness [ 28]. Initial infection with BK and JC strains of polyomavirus, which show high prevalence and rates of acquisition of antibody in school children and adults [ 29, 30], is not known to affect them clinically. However, in immunocompromised patients (e.g., with AIDS, Hodgkinâ€™s disease, or renal transplantation), previously asymptomatic JC virus infection may evolve into progressive multifocal leukoencephalopathy[ 31]. Other primary or often reactivated infections are common in immunodeficient states; regardless of their clinical expression in normal hosts, most of the herpesviruses are more likely to cause mild to life-threatening complications.
